Reviews.Title: “GOOD PLACE”
Reviews.Author: DAVID C
Reviews.Content: STAYED 12/9/11-12/12/11. This hotel is a great value. The rooms are clean and comfortable. There's no breakfast but there's alot of places to eat nearby.they have a pool and hot tub. there are alot of hotels in Mission Valley but not at this price. you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find!”
Reviews.Author: CopacabanaGrill
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the size, decor, and cleanliness of the rooms. Since Premier is local small chain (part of EZ8), I was unsure of what to expect. The reviews online were all positive, so I booked. Oh, yeah, since i was a bit short on money, the price was definitely an enticement. It is hard to find a hotel in the $40-80 range in San Diego on a good day, but in July it is impossible, but the Premier had rooms in this range. The rooms are large, full basic cable lineup on the TV. Showers were nicely built walk-in types (not tubes). Fridge in each room. They also have a hot tub that people seemed to really enjoy. The hotel is on the bus line and about a 15-20 minute walk to Fashion Valley mall. The bus ride is about 5 minutes. Be careful, though, because the bus does not run on Sundays. Only downside, is that they have free internet in the lobby on some old computer! In your room you have to pay $5 per day. But apparently you can also pay $10 for a month of service that you can use at this hotel, other hotels, in airports, on planes, etc. So I suggest just paying the $10 if you will be here more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiigirl44
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located close to Sea World. There's a pool we did not use but it looked decent. They had a very basic continental breakfast, hey I was just after the coffee. I didn't expect a budget hotel to have breakfast at all, so that was a plus. There was a fridge in the room. Comfortable beds. Clean linens. I read somewhere the rooms smelled funny but I didn't experience this. I have stayed here 3 times. I am and have been satisfied with the quality of the hotel for what little money we paid. No complaints here! I've seen worse rooms out there. There is a Denny's close by which we ate at each morning.

Reviews.Title: “good value - economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob84403
Reviews.Content: This is a good value in economy lodging. It is on the north side of I-8 in the Hotel Circle area, very close to Old Town (historic area with shopping, restaurants, etc). I have spent about 15 nights here over the last few years. A computer/internet is available in the lobby at no additional charge for time or printing small jobs (not sure what is available in the rooms). Close to several restaurants with good access to all freeways (and thus attractions/destinations) via I-8.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, greaty staff”
Reviews.Author: junglecat64
Reviews.Content: With AAA discount, we paid $61 per night including tax, less than at Motel 6 right around the corner. This motel looks terrible, but the rooms are fine and the front desk staff that I encountered was very helpful. The kids and I enjoyed the pool and hot tub, and the way it overlooks the San Diego Mission up on the hill. Once this pprperty gets internet access, I will for sure stay here for business. We spoke to a toung couple from Germany, families from Phoenix, Mexico and elsewhere....it is a real mix of people who stay here. My wife prefers Hampton Inns and similar, but agreed that this place (although not here first choice) was OK

Reviews.Title: “Sleaze is the name of the game! Don't ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: debbisio
Reviews.Content: The AAA approved Premier Inn(San Diego) was clean, as advertised, but not particularly safe(3 policemen came and arrested an individual while we were staying there. In addition, the smoking in the hallway by individuals was not to our liking, and finally, it took three tries to get checked in. We were first told by phone(before we began the trip) that checkin in is between 2 and 3 pm. I indicated we would arrive a bit before two. We were told we would have to wait for that bit of time. We arrived, and attempted to check in at about 2:30-NO ROOMS WERE READY. We were then told by the toothless woman at the reception desk that rooms would be ready about 3:30 or 4. I indicated that we were not happy and had an elderly person with us who needed to rest, but agreed to come back then. Thankfully, I called ahead again and was told NO ROOMS WERE READY at 3:45 ish. Finally, 2 of the 4 rooms were available at about 4:15, a little more than an hour before our event at 6pm. The next two rooms became available shortly after that-the young lady who handled the check in at that time was professional. The arrest, however was upsetting to two of my party who were in the office drinking coffee Saturday morning. I plan to go to San Diego again, but with what happened at Premier Inn, I am not convinced that is the place to stay. Office staff was hit and miss-a tooth-challenged, poorly groomed woman was almost helpless as a front desk person and not personable or friendly, while the replacement woman later in the day was professional. The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired, including-NO child friendly beverages, only sweets, no proteins. Parking was almost non-existent, and the hotel should NOT be a AAA club recommended location. Even at appx. $55/night per room, my money was not well spent. I requested a refund upon my return from our event, and am STILL WAITING! Still waiting for a refund, after 3 complaints-one to the desk about slow availabilty of rooms to be ready, one to the reservation company, and one to corporate of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel services are not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: eZWest
Reviews.Content: I run a small business and I required internet services while on this trip. Two of us checked in the hotel at 3pm and we paid for five nights. We were unable to connect to wifi services as advertised. The front desk and management was not concerned that there was no wifi,. The front desk gave us a telephone number to contact the internet provider; after many calls, each contact we were told we would be contacted back within the hour, however none of our calls were ever returned. We finally checked out the following day and found a hotel that did in fact provide wifi internet service. If you need wifi / internet service during your stay in San Diego then do not expect to receive this advertised service at this hotel; This advertised service is simply a lie as of this review.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Place!”
Reviews.Author: happygirl1_7
Reviews.Content: We took a short weekend trip to San Diego recently and stayed at the Premier Inn. It is right next door to Holiday Inn Express and half the price! Our room was not huge but it was clean and neat. Who needs a huge room anyway? The beds were comfortable and we did not have problems with noise from other guests. Tried the spa. Everything was great considering price and location. Lots of taco shops and close to grocery stores and restaurants. Right across the bay from Sea World.

HotelInfo.Name: Premier Inns Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 2484 Hotel Circle Place, San Diego, CA 92108
